result.execSummary:
The defendant David W. Hron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David W. Hron in court with attorney Melissa Hope Dalkert. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:24 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.

There is an agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1.
Defendant will plead to Count 4.
Defendant will plead to Count 5.

Atty Dalkert concurs, defense is free to argue.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters pleas of: NO CONTEST to Count 1, Count 4 and Count 5

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Dalkert for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 5: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Dalkert makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 2 Years
Conditions:
Jail sentence of 150 Days
Huber granted for employment and any counseling
All may be served on GPS electronic monitoring
Continue to comply with counseling Defendant has been involved in
Sign all necessary releases to ensure compliance
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Obtain all prescriptions from a single pharmacy
Submit DNA Sample
Pay court costs
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
(no dna surcharge)

Count 4:
Jail sentence of 20 day jail sentence Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for employment and any counseling
First half in jail, second half on GPS electronic monitoring
Probation for a period of 18 Months concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Pay costs
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1

Count 5:
Jail sentence of 20 day jail sentence Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to Count 4
Huber granted for employment and any counseling
First half in jail, second half on GPS electronic monitoring
Probation for a period of 18 Months concurrent to Count 1 and Count 4
Conditions:
Pay costs
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 4

20 days in which to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for David W. Hron
Current: 10344 County Road B, Amherst, WI 54406   (Effective: 11-25-2015)
Prior: 10344 Cth B, Amherst, WI 54406
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference at 02-29-2016 09:30 am

Defendant David W. Hron in court with attorney Melissa Hope Dalkert. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:17 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
This is a preliminary hearing.
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued

State files Information.
Defendant's attorney received copy of information.  Defendant's attorney states the count difference from the Complaint on the record.
Defendant/attorney waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered to all counts.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 01-11-2016 03:00 pm

Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. Defendant David W. Hron in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
